page.title: 06LANDSCAPE-2
page.content: Oxhill lies on the stream called the{ Oxhill Torrent whilst Whatcote lies close to Wynyates Brook. Whatcote has three remaining ponds,the largest called Wellpool was cleared in 1983, another was the Wheelwrights pond, the third behind the church is very old. Oxhill has several Hornton stone houses remaining,two with thatched roofs, whilst Whatcote has 8 original{ Blue Lyas or Hornton Stone houses left but has 9 modern rebuilt or barn conversions.The remainder are brick. About 70% of the trees were elms all killed by {Dutch Elm Disease}leaving the lowland areas relatively bare.All of the roads are based on{Drove Roads} with wide grass verges which are a mass of wild flowers in spring and summer if left uncut.
